titleStmt.title: T. M. McCarty et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4365

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlett
Governor of the State of Kentucky

your petioner would respectfully represent that William L Johnson was at the October term of the Trimble Circuit Court fined Seventy Five dollars for Stabing James Bell, on the premises of your petioner, William L. Johnson an act which he was provoked to do by threatening language which his victim used toward him, and further he would represent that he is poor and unable to pay the find, and has a family of a wife and Two children, And William L. Johnson, prays you that he is a law abiding man has never Solicited any difficulty with no person, and that he sacrificed his former home, and moved Ten miles of from his persecutors to avoid further difficulty, and he would pray you to remit his find or as much of it as your Excellency may judge propper

T M McCarty
Jno Mikin
Jas. B. Cook
George Wright
B. G. Wright
T. E. Skidmore
R H Knisley
D S Lane
E Ray
L. McKere
W P Maddox

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
Wm L. Johnson
$75 --
Stabbing
Respited 12 mos
16th Nov 1863
